__e: I've had enough trouble on account of... your husband.
He always here someone drags: dogs, vagrants, drunks.
Haven't we had enough trouble getting you out of town?
You've had enough problems for tonight.
I went to a lot of trouble to get your exit permit
There's enough worry for both of us.
I hope we won't have any trouble about my name down there.
That means no police interference and the credit for a month.
No trouble with the police yet.
Bet you get into all kinds of trouble... he don't even know about.
If I'm her best hope, then that little girl is in a hell of a lot more trouble than you think.
- and I promise you I shall cause more trouble than you bargained for... If you don't return my property!
You done had all the botheration you can stand.
I'm in enough trouble as it is. You and your kitten.
Dammit, H. I., ain't we got enough to contend with?
Dammit, H. I., ain't we got enough to contend with?
Well, we've had our troubles around here too, as you can see.
I'm causing so much trouble... as if you don't have enough of your own.
